entry.title: Why I still develop synchronous web in the asyncIO era
entry.summary:
Description

Since python 3.4 the introduction of the asyncIO module produced a new way of building web applications and tons of new frameworks. With asyncIO we take advantage of large throughput over the network, but is it really everything about web development?

entry.title: weppy: the web framework for humans
entry.summary:
Description

Why another python web framework? Do we really need to innovate the Django and Flask scene? Could we? This talk will address all these questions, introducing weppy: the full stack python web framework designed with simplicity in mind.

entry.title: pyDAL: a pure python Database Abstraction Layer
entry.summary:
Description

This talk will provide an overview and quick demonstration of the features and the APIs of pyDAL, the python Database Abstraction Layer. It dynamically generates the SQL in real time using the specified dialect for the database back end, so that you do not have to write SQL code or learn different SQL dialects (the term SQL is used generically), and your code will be portable among different types of databases. pyDAL comes from the original web2py's DAL, with the aim of being wide-compatible. pyDAL doesn't require web2py and can be used in any Python context.
